Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simulates a player in the game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Makes a new board object for player ( Each board has 2 pieces: Player's board and opponet's board) Makes 5 ships for the player initializes players board with empty spaces in his board (No ship is located for now)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Makes a new board object for player ( Each board has 2 pieces: Player's board and opponet's board) Makes 5 ships for the player initializes players board with empty spaces in his board (No ship is located for now)

    • Method Detail

      • chooseShips

        public void chooseShips(int angleStatus,
                        int length,
                        int shipNum)
        Parameters:
        angleStatus - Angle status for selected ship (0: vertical | 1: horizontal)
        length - Length of the chosen ship
        shipNum - Ship number Can be from {0,1,2,3,4}

      • placeShips

        public void placeShips(int shipNum)
        Places chosen ship on the player's board
        Parameters:
        shipNum - is the ship number chosen. Can be from {0,1,2,3,4}

      • checkAvailable

        public boolean checkAvailable(int x,
                              int y,
                              int shipNum)
        Check if it is available for a ship to be placed in the given coordinates or not
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        shipNum - Ship number we want to check if its available to place it on the given coordinates
        Returns:
        true: Its avaiable to place the ship in the given coordinates | false: Its not available to place the ship in the given coordinates
